info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 06 at 7:22PM EDT until April 06 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL COLUMBIA...NORTHERN RICHMOND...EDGEFIELD... NORTHWESTERN AIKEN...SOUTHEASTERN SALUDA AND SOUTHEASTERN MCCORMICK COUNTIES... At 722 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Johnston, or 18 miles west of Batesburg-Leesville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include... Aiken, North Augusta, Evans, Batesburg-Leesville, Belvedere, Martinez, Edgefield, Johnston, Ridge Spring, USC Aiken, Edgefield County Airport, Aiken Municipal Airport, Graniteville, Gloverville, Monetta, Trenton, Ward, Strom Thurmond High School, Poverty Hill and Cleora. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 1 and 37. Interstate 520 in South Carolina between mile markers 22 and 23. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for east central Georgia...and central South Carolina. For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows. Severe thunderstorms can produce large capsizing waves and frequent lightning. If on or near Lake Strom Thurmond move away from the water and take shelter!
